title: Cynthia Erivo rocks green hair with green Rosie Assoulin gown at Harriet premiere in Washington, DC
text:
The Color Purple thespian Cynthia Erivo coordinated her green buzzcut with a green-floral Rosie Assoulin gown for the Washington, DC premiere of her film Harriet on Tuesday.

The British-Nigerian 32-year-old - who's an Oscar away from EGOT status - struck a pose in the puffed-sleeve creation and yellow Brian Atwood heels selected by stylist Jason Bolden.

Rocking plenty of Cartier jewelry, the Boss Baby actress had her 'seaglass'-shaded hair colored by hairstylist Coree Moreno.

'It's literally a dream!' Cynthia Erivo coordinated her green buzzcut with a green-floral Rosie Assoulin gown for the Washington, DC premiere of her film Harriet on Tuesday

And make-up artist Terrell Mullin brought out Cynthia's big brown eyes with lashes, cat eyeliner, defined brows, and a glossy pink pout.

Erivo - who boasts 383K social media followers - gushed on Instagram on Tuesday: 'It's literally a dream [come true].'

The 5ft belter has built her entire career on playing African-Americans and in Harriet - hitting US theaters November 1 - she takes on slave-turned-abolitionist Harriet Tubman.

Ominously, Kasi Lemmons' biopic on the legendary scout, spy, nurse, and suffragette only scored a 63% critic approval rating (from 38 reviews) on Rotten Tomatoes.

Glam: The British-Nigerian 32-year-old - who's an Oscar away from EGOT status - struck a pose in the puffed-sleeve creation and yellow Brian Atwood heels selected by stylist Jason Bolden

Matchy matchy: Rocking plenty of Cartier jewelry, the Boss Baby actress had her 'seaglass'-shaded hair colored by hairstylist Coree Moreno

Contoured complexion: Make-up artist Terrell Mullin brought out Cynthia's big brown eyes with lashes, cat eyeliner, defined brows, and a glossy pink pout

While inside the National Museum of African American History and Culture, the God Only Knows songstress got a private tour and posed beside a portrait of Harriet Tubman.

Next month, the RADA grad begins work playing the late Queen of Soul Aretha Franklin in National Geographic's anthology biopic series Genius: Aretha premiering next spring.

Cynthia just performed a powerful cover of the 18-time Grammy winner's 1968 hit Ain't No Way during the Fifth Annual Elsie Fest in Manhattan on October 5.

Erivo next appears on the October 30th episode of CBS' The Late Show with Stephen Colbert alongside The Walking Dead star Norman Reedus and musical guest Miranda Lambert.

Hitting US theaters November 1! Erivo has built her entire career on playing African-Americans and in Harriet, she takes on slave-turned-abolitionist Harriet Tubman

Honored: While inside the National Museum of African American History and Culture, the God Only Knows songstress got a private tour and posed beside a portrait of Harriet Tubman

Premiering next spring! Next month, the RADA grad begins work playing the late Queen of Soul Aretha Franklin in National Geographic's anthology biopic series Genius: Aretha

Vanessa Bell Calloway - who plays Harriet's mother Rit Ross - flaunted considerable cleavage in a black velvet gown featuring a dramatic train and thigh-high slit.

Sugarland singer Jennifer Nettles - who plays villainous Eliza - glimmered in a pink champagne-shaded sequinned gown selected by stylist Hayley Atkin.

Gentlemen suited and booted included Leslie Odom Jr., Zackary Momoh, and Nick Basta - who play the Underground Railroad's William Still, Harriet's husband John Tubman, and Foxx.

Director Kasi Lemmons posed between her husband Vonde Curtis-Hall and son Henry Hunter Hall, who portray Reverend Green and Walter in the film.

Plays Harriet's mother Rit Ross! Vanessa Bell Calloway flaunted considerable cleavage in a black velvet gown featuring a dramatic train and thigh-high slit

Plays villainous Eliza! Sugarland singer Jennifer Nettles glimmered in a pink champagne-shaded sequinned gown selected by stylist Hayley Atkin

Castmates: Gentlemen suited and booted included (from L-R) Leslie Odom Jr., Zackary Momoh, and Nick Basta - who play the Underground Railroad's William Still, Harriet's husband John Tubman, and Foxx

Family affair! Director Kasi Lemmons posed between her husband Vonde Curtis-Hall (L) and son Henry Hunter Hall (R), who portray Reverend Green and Walter in the film

With the Harriet premiere in the Nation's Capital, journalists like White House Correspondent April Ryan were able to attend the red carpet festivities.

Also there was U.S. House of Representatives Majority Leader Steny Hoyer, who represents the Fifth Congressional District of Maryland (where Harriet Tubman grew up).

And representing Tubman herself there were two of her descendants - great-great-grandniece Judith Bryant and great-great-great grandniece Ernestine Tina Martin Wyatt.

'Tonight is all about Harriet!' With the Harriet premiere in the Nation's Capital, journalists like White House Correspondent April Ryan were able to attend the red carpet festivities

'Enjoyed my time tonight!' Also there was U.S. House of Representatives Majority Leader Steny Hoyer, who represents the Fifth Congressional District of Maryland (where Harriet Tubman grew up)
description: The British-Nigerian 32-year-old - who's an Oscar away from EGOT status - got to take a private tour of the National Museum of African American History and Culture
